To find the amount of milk Mary collects every day, first calculate how much milk the group producing 1kg/sheep produces: this equals [(2291443)/2]*1 which simplifies as follows : [2291443/(2)]*[1]=1145721.5
Next compute how much milk the remaining halves can supply: This works out as follows:[2291443]/2]*[2],and further simplified becomes  1145721*2=2291442
Now add what was calculated above ([1145721]+[2291442])to get finally: 3437163 liters of milk produced

direct_answer.text:
Firstly, we need to determine how many sheep contribute to the production of milk. According to the hint, half of the sheep contributes 1 kg of milk while the other half provides twice as much, which means it yields 2 kg of milk. Therefore, this can be represented mathematically as follows:

Total Number Of Sheep Producing 1 Kg/Day =  2291443/2   ≈    1145721.5 . But since we don't deal with fractions of live organisms, so round off the decimal points resulting into integers ,i.e. ~~ Approximately~~ **Approximately** equals to around ***1,145,722*** sheep that produces 1 Kg milk daily
Similarly :

NumberOfSheepsProducing2KgPerDay =  2291443/2     ≈    1145721.5 ,after rounded approximaion becomes         ---->                Around                             --              ====          ---- -->       About               ===           ==>            ++++===============        >>>> >----><------<<<----- ->-------------->---
